mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to William Pearce, 1796 May 29
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A pipe of wine and a box of tea sent from Philadelphia--Windsor chairs--Mr. Aimes traveling to the federal city--Mr. Lear will show him the way to Mt. Vernon--inquires of Maria and the two boys--early wheat and other small grains, peas and grasses--India hemp--expects to have many respectable visitors during his stay at Mt. Vernon, and hopes to find everything in good order. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages
